data.title: Beyond Good and Evil 20th anniversary edition rated by ESRB for Switch/PS4/PS5/PC/Xbox Series [Update: Reveal at the LRG Showcase on June 20th]
data.text:
Bokuringo

Koopa

Pronouns

He/Him

Nov 28, 2023

#1

ESRB rates Beyond Good & Evil 20th Anniversary Edition for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Switch, and PC

The Entertainment Software Rating Board has rated Beyond Good & Evil 20th Anniversary Edition for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC.

The rating suggests Ubisoft will re-release the original Beyond Good & Evil for newer platforms in celebration of its 20th anniversary. Beyond Good & Evil first launched on November 11, 2003. Its most recent ports were PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions released in 2011

Beyond Good & Evil - 20th Anniversary Edition Achievements - Xbox Series, Xbox One

Achievements, guides, leaderboards, and discussion forums for Beyond Good & Evil - 20th Anniversary Edition

Edit:

Buy Beyond Good & Evil - 20th Anniversary Edition | Xbox

Rediscover the cult classic in a special edition celebrating its 20th anniversary! Embark on this epic adventure in up to 4K, 60 fps with improved graphics and audio, a brand-new speedrun mode, updated achievements, and an exclusive anniversary gallery! Enjoy unique new rewards as you explore...

Last edited: Nov 28, 2023

Nov 29, 2023

#31

Great. I dig this poster.

BGE was one of my favorite game of the GC/PS2/XB era. The music was so good (Christophe Heral, who also did Rayman's OSTs), the world intriguing (and full of furries), the french voice acting was perfect (it better be for a french game, mind you).

I hope this can shed a little light for BGE 2. Restart the whole thing at this point, let it be what is was supposed to be : a sequel, not a weird prequel that retcon the original.

Jun 13, 2024

#40

a trophy list and a Patch PKG are now up for the PS5 version, suggesting it’s releasing very soon.

though for the record, a trophy list for the Sands of Time remake has also been on the PSN backend for a while despite getting delayed to 2026.

I believe the situation with that was the original version (with the heavily criticized graphical upgrade) was nearly finished before Ubisoft decided to completely redo it from scratch.
